I am using Hottowel,

I defined a directive:

(function() { ‘use strict’;

angular
    .module('app')
    .directive('directionDirective', directionDirective);

directionDirective.$inject = ['$window'];

function directionDirective ($window) {
    // Usage:
    //     
    // Creates:
    // 
    var directive = {
        link: link,
        restrict: 'A',
        require : ['^ngModel'],
        scope : {
            ngModel : "="
        },
    };
    return directive;

    function link(scope, element, attrs, ctrl) {
        var selectpicker = $(iElement);

        selectpicker.selectpicker({
            size : 10,
            width : '100%',
            noneSelectedText : 'No selection'
        });

        scope.$watch(function(){return $(iElement).find("option").length }, function() {
            selectpicker.selectpicker('refresh');
        });
    }
}

})();

I suspect I need a factory to get it to work, because I get errors stating that it can’t be found.
